intro: Senecio triqueter, commonly known as the three-angled senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, narrow leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces clusters of yellow flowers, which are typically arranged in inflorescences at the ends of the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Senecio triqueter is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers.
